value: View of Hitzacker and the Elbe from the Weinberg

is a charming little riverside town in Lüchow-Dannenberg district in the
region of North Germany. It lies on the River Elbe, about 45 km east of

on the a tourist route, the German Timber-Frame Road.

Augustus the Younger, Duke of Brunswick-Lüneburg, founded a famous library here, which was moved to
Hitzacker lies at the confluence of the River Jeetzel with the mighty
. Immediately northwest are the Elbe Heights (
), a range of low hills along the Elbe river and a favourite walking area. The lowland areas of the old town are par of the Elbe valley water meadows (

).

Whilst the riverbanks lie just 11 metres above sea level, Hitzacker's local hill, the
reaches a modest 83 metres. A little way down the Elbe, the
hill (86 m) has great views over the Elbe basin.
The earliest known settlements date to around 3000 B.C. at the lake of
and the region has been continuously settled since. On the

) there are traces of an eighth-century Slavic castle that turned Hitzacker into an important trading post. It was granted town rights in 1258, whereupon the castle lost its significance and fell into ruins.

In 1548, a fire reduced the village of Hitzacker to ashes apart from the church and one house and there was an another serious fire in 1668. In the Polabian or Wendish language of the region, that died out in the 18th century, Hitzacker was known as

).

The borough of Hitzacker was formed in 1972 from ten independent parishes.

From Lüneburg, take the B 216 east towards Dannenberg and turn left at Metzingen toward Hitzacker.
From Dannenberg, take the B 216 west towards Lüneburg and, just outside the town, turn right at Streetz towards Hitzacker.
Hitzacker is small enough to walk around the old town, riverside and Weinberg.

- Hitzacker's local hill from which there are great views over the town and the River Elbe.

content=The restaurant for the Hotel Hafen Hitzacker. Good service and reasonable menu. The restaurant looks out over the harbour.
content=Serves typical local cuisine including asparagus dishes, game,
and fish (perch, trout, pike, carp and char) caught in the Elbe and Jeetzel rivers.
content=Quaint cafe-restaurant on the banks of the river. Traditional German menu including fish and game dishes.
directions=heading into Hitzacker on the L 231 (Lüneburger Str.), turn L onto the K 36, Gelderländer Str., take the first R into Schützenweg. Hotel is 2nd L
content=Four star hotel on the heights above the Elbe just outside the main town. 90 rooms, sport and recreation facilities.
price=€49 pppn for two people. €44 pppn for 7 nights +

content=Two star, family-run hotel in the spa area of Hitzacker, 300 m from the Kurhaus and on the edge of the forest. Restaurant, cafe, terrace, sauna and bicycle hire. The hotel are happy to arrange dancing evenings, horse-and-cart rides, BBQs, cycle tours, boat rides, nature trips and more.
address=Contact address only: Elbtalaue-Wendland Touristik GmbH, Rundling Lübeln 2, 29482 Küsten
price=€33 pppn for two people staying
content=Modest guest house in a central, but quiet location in the historic town centre of Hitzacker. Sport boat harbour and pier nearby. Restaurant serves traditional fare.
content=Modern, four star hotel overlooking the little harbour in Hitzacker. Within walking distance of all the main sites.
